turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: The key -- the key -- the clue -- what does this man recall on his death bed? Okay, Mank, you're dying. What's the last image that comes to you? Right now.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: This girl on a dock. White dress. Never said a word to her.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Why her?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: She was . . . innocent

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: All men love. But men like Hearst -- they don't bother with convention because--

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: They don't have to.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: He loves in his own way. On his conditions. Because those are the only conditions he has ever known.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Hearst looks down at the world at his feet Everything has always been beneath him.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: And what does he see?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: The people. When they pay him homage, he adores them. But when they have the ... audacity to question him. To doubt him. To embarrass him. Then he despises them.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: And when he looks up? What does he dream about?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It's 350 pages long.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Yeah, but the margins are real wide.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It is 350 pages of ... ABSOLUTE INSPIRATION!

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: It's good, huh?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Good?! Good?! Words fail you at last! It's terrific! Now I'll have to do some shaping, of course, and some of the scenes aren't exactly . . . exactly . . .

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Short enough. But this is a grand start And I think we need to change the name.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: The title?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: No, AMERICAN is a blessed title directly sent from God's soul to your mind. We shall never change that! I mean the name of the publisher. Charles Foster Craig doesn't have the knives-out poetry I need. I was thinking about "Kane" -- you like that?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Cain -- like the Bible guy?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: K-A-N-E. One strong syllable. Kane I

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Craig is one syllable

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: But it's not a great syllable

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: I --um-- I don't know if I should. I ain't been drinking since I started on this--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: To my invaluable comrade Drink up!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Jesus Christ --

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: YOU CAN'T DO THIS TOME -- THIS WAS OUR STORY, REMEMBER? -- YOU AND ME AND GODDAMN EVERYONE ELSE - - REMEMBER THAT?!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: And I'm looking at them -- and they're all looking at me and I don't know who should pour the tea. '

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I just can't . . see it anymore

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I want you back

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Fuck you.  You wanted me out. I'm out.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: I don't care.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Did I ever tell you about my father?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: I don't give a shit about-

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: He was a drunk. And he was my father and I was ashamed of him.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Hey, kid. Gregg.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Mank, sit down. You missed the opening of the new picture but I'll go back--

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: No, you gotta hear this-

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: No, but I can imagine. What am I today? A "puny upstart" or a "spoiled dilettante" -- no, she wouldn't know how to spell that

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: "And how is the country to feel when this industry continues to employ bedraggled foreigners and swarthy refugees instead of real Americans? Doesn't Hollywood know there's a Depression on? Don't real Americans deserve work?"

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Well, at least she's off KANE today

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: No she's not. Don't you get it, ya lunk? She's using code language to the studio bosses. "Bedraggled foreigners and swarthy refugees" -- who the hell do you think she's talking about?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Hedy Lamarr?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Jews. She's talking about Jews.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Who owns this town? Who runs every goddamn studio? The tribe, baby. These fuckers hear the word "Jew" and they start sweating. Like Ester Williams' pool they start sweating.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: So they're Jews. . .

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: This is just the first shot. Maestro. Sooner or later she's gonna use the word. And all those boys know that there is only one thing this country hates more than the coloreds and that's the Jews.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Christ.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Me, I'm proud to be a Jew, I got no problem. You don't like it, fuck you. But with these guys it's like a dirty word. All they wanna be is good red- white-and-blue Americans, and the way they see it you can't be a good American and a Jew. So Sam Goldfish becomes Sam Goldwyn and David Selznick becomes David 0. Selznick -- like anyone's gonna think he's Irish for fuck's sake--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: What does this have to do with--?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Believe you me, they're gonna do anything -- and I mean absolutely anything -- to stop that word from gettin' out.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: What?! Are they going to kill me? Is that what they're going to do?!

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: If he had known about KANE before you made it, you'd be dead already.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It's too late. The movie's made

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: They won't let it out. Not Hearst. Not the other studio heads--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: You wrote the damn thing, Mank Aren't you going to fight for it?!

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: I told you this was going to happen! I told you he was going to come after us! So we took the chance anyway and we lost. That's how it goes, okay? I got my check, kid, and so did you -- and that's what it's all about -- so fuck it and move on.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Is that from one of the Gospels?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Kinda.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: YOU STUPID, LITTLE MAN! HOW COULD YOU HAVE LET THIS HAPPEN?! I GAVE YOU MY SOUL AND NOW YOU'RE GOING TO SELL IT!?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: This ain't George's doing--!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: You gonna watch?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Hell, I know how it ends.  Hey, Rosebud's the sled!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Mank!

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Face it, Orson, they're gonna hate it. I told you, not enough closeups and too many scenes with a bunch of New York actors.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Shit

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: George...

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: What have I done?

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Aw, cheer up, George'll probably be running Fox by the morning. Let's get a drink.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: You know, all this nightmare we went through with Hearst. The whole thing... And in the end, probably no one will ever remember the picture anyway.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Yeah, you're probably right.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: He truly doesn't care if he ever works again.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Yeah, ain't it swell?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: They came to me with an offer. 800,000 for the negative and all the prints.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: And they went to the stockholders in New York.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Oh God.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: I been talking to Swanbeck in New York and... Orson, I think they're gonna take it A long pause as Welles looks at Schaefer

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: Monstro! Ran into Walter Winchell outside He wants to play Herod in the picture. Hiya, George.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Herman.

turns.speaker: MANK
turns.text: So ain't this just the bee's knees? The high muckey-mucks dolled up all Aztec-like for the human sacrifice.

turns.speaker: SHOP OWNER
turns.text: May I help you?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I, um, need an estimate on some jewelry I might wish to sell. But d-d-discretion is very important to me b-b-because I don't want anyone t-t-to, um, know that--

turns.speaker: SHOP OWNER
turns.text: Excuse me, I hope this isn't rude, but aren't you Marion Davies?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SHOP OWNER
turns.text: Well, this is a great pleasure. Miss Davies! I just saw that ENCHANTMENT is playing at a the Tivoli, the revival house in Santa Monica. That was a fine picture!

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Thank you-

turns.speaker: SHOP OWNER
turns.text: Not one of them today has what you had, Miss Davies. Not one of them.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Thank you -- b-b-but I'd really like t-t-to--

turns.speaker: SHOP OWNER
turns.text: Of course, of course. How can we be of service?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: As I said I have some j-j-j-j-  that I might wish t-t-to sell and I wanted an estimate--

turns.speaker: SHOP OWNER
turns.text: Surely My pleasure, Miss Davies..

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: It came.

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: 800,000 dollars fully covers the production budget and a little more. Hell, George, you even make a profit on the deal.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Very generous

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: And we gotta be clear here. I need the negative and every existing print.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: To do what?

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: That's for me to decide.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You're going to destroy it

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: No, maybe put it on the shelf until the old man kicks it.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You're lying to me.

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: We already made the same offer to the stockholders.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You talked to New York?

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: Yes

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You talked to Mr. Swanbeck?

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: Yes

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Get out

turns.speaker: MAYER
turns.text: You're bettin' on an inside straight this time. You'll never pull it off.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: PAUL STEWART
turns.text: "Rosebud? I'll tell you about Rosebud.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Again.

turns.speaker: PAUL STEWART
turns.text: "Rosebud? I'll tell you about Rosebud.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Again.

turns.speaker: PAUL STEWART
turns.text: "Rosebud? I'll tell you about Rosebud.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Again

turns.speaker: PAUL STEWART
turns.text: "Rosebud? I'll tell you about Rosebud."

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Again

turns.speaker: PAUL STEWART
turns.text: "Rosebud? I'll tell you about Rosebud

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Again

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It's an awful title, of course, but I can't think of anything better. Someone came up with A SEA OF UPTURNED FACES -- which has a nice, grand ring to it -- and I thought of JOHN CITIZEN, USA but that strikes me as a bit Warner Brothers. Or, God forbid, Capraesque. I suppose AMERICAN will do for now but--

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: CITIZEN KANE

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Pardon?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: CITIZEN KANE There's your title.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: A "Z" and a "K" in the title. That would draw the eye. For the poster. I like that THE PRISONER OF ZENDA had a "Z" and a "P" and that worked--

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Now look, Orson, let's not get ahead of ourselves. The budget projections on this--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I know, I know! But what more can you expect of me?! I have pared this story down to the marrow to save money but to cut more would be to--!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Listen, get off your horse with me. You know I've stuck by you since the beginning of time it seems like, while the stockholders in New York were ready to cut and run and everyone else in Hollywood was set to toss me in a rubber room. But your contract stipulates a max budget of 500 thousand. This one's gonna come in at 750 thousand. What do we do about that?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Now don't have a fit -- but I want you to think again about doing WAR OF THE WORLDS-

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Jesus

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Do WAR OF THE WORLDS as a feature and everyone's happy. You make some money and New York's happy and you have a track record and then we'll move on to KANE.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Please don't ask me to do this.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: It's the safe bet, Orson. There's nothing wrong with that.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: For the title

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Ah, it's a grand title.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: This is an abomination There's no music and--

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: They've all seen a rough cut

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: The magazines are one thing -- but Hedda! Why did we have to let her come?!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: When Hedda says "I'm coming" you mix a lot of martinis and you pray.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: And this is the evening edition. Notice anything?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: The ad..

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What do you want me to do, Orson? Radio City won't premiere the picture. Louella threatened them with some bullshit about

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Then find another theater

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You don't think I've tried? No one is willing to open the picture

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Then we'll open it in Detroit or Dallas or Kalamazoo for God's sake! We'll show it in goddamn circus tents and--!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Listen to me. The press ban is killing us and the distributors won't book it. And meantime I'm dealing with the stockholders in New York who are scared shitless -- and I'm this far from getting fired myself -- and you don't have a friend in the world but me right now. So you have got to trust that I'll do what I can to--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: "Do what you can"?! That's not good enough I

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Well it' s all you've got !

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: You're with them, aren't you? You're going to bury my movie. They bought you!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: For Christ's sake, shut up--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Why don't you just have the guts to admit it

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: How dare you talk to me like that! Do you think I'm like all the rest of those pirates?! Like Mayer and Warner? Is that what you think--?!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It's just that my movie is so-

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: "Your movie" -- I am so sick of that! It's your movie -- but it's his life! Did you ever think about that?! Did you ever think about that old man and Marion having to watch as you tore them apart?!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Do you every think for one second that you might have some responsibility for what you're doing?! For cutting and slashing everything in your way so you can have your goddamn movie?!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: That soulless monster gets no tears from me.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Who the fuck are you trying to kid? You are that soulless monster.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: This isn' t some kinda fucking game! You know how many people RKO employs?! You know how many people depend on what we do for a living?!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I really think you're

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You wanna commit suicide, fine! You got some death- wish, fine! But you will not drag this company down with you!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It was a -joke, George

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: You're not still mad at me, I hope

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: No, we're jake. But listen-

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Look, not a single scene shot in the studio! We've found natural locations for the whole story--

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Hold on a sec. I got news. We finally found somewhere to premiere KANE but--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I told you! Where? Grauman's? El Capitan? Or did Radio City come crawling back?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: The Palace in New York. But Orson there's something else.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: I think you better sit down

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I don't want to sit

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It's my birthday this week. I'll be 26.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Happy birthday.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Oh God. . .

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Relax, George. It's gonna go great. Trust me. Have I ever lied to you?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You know something, Orson, you haven't done anything but lie to me from the moment we met. But, ya know, I'd do it again in a second.

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It was fun, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: It was the best, kid

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: So, on to the Life Of Christ!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Without me. I'm afraid. I got the axe this morning.

turns.speaker: TOLAND
turns.text: Orson, you wanna take five?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Five...? Yes. No. We're done today

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: It's just not low enough. This is the scene. We have to look up at these two man as pillars soaring to the sky. As towering virtues in combat--

turns.speaker: TOLAND
turns.text: Spare me the aria, I know what you want--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I need my shoes in total focus right here and also Joe back there--!

turns.speaker: TOLAND
turns.text: I know what you want but it can't be done!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Take apart the fucking camera rig -- we could get a few more inches down and then tilt up--

turns.speaker: TOLAND
turns.text: Orson -- we can't get the fucking camera any fucking lower so find another fucking shot!

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: How 'bout a real drink?

turns.speaker: TOLAND
turns.text: We done?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TOLAND
turns.text: Oh, no--

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: TOLAND
turns.text: He's Christ?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: I'm Christ

turns.speaker: TOLAND
turns.text: You want to do the life of Jesus?

turns.speaker: WELLES
turns.text: Yes! Vibrant and modern and stark like a Picasso sketch drawn to flashes of lightning I We shoot the whole thing in the gallant American West--

turns.speaker: 1ST DEPUTY
turns.text: Let's go, Jake, wake up!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Huh? Whadda ya mean, get up?

turns.speaker: 1ST DEPUTY
turns.text: We're from...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I know where you're from. You guys look the same every place.

turns.speaker: 1ST DEPUTY
turns.text: They wanna talk to you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: 1ST DEPUTY
turns.text: I don't run the joint. They just told me to bring you in.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: Hey champ!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Tommy, thanks for coming over.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: You just take it easy, now. You'll do all right. Feelin' Ok?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm Ok.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: Just come by to wish you luck.  Need anything?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, we're all right. Thanks anyway, Tommy.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: Ok, champ.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: All right. I don't have to hear any more. I think I understand what happened. I understand it was your brother's wife and there was probably a misunderstanding. I'm not sayin' Salvy shouldn't have acted the way he did. But, Joey, you don't raise your hands. You don't do that kind of thing. This time we forget about it but no more after this. You understand?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah, I understand, Tommy.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: All right, you guys, shake hands.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: Aside from everything else, your family all right?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah, they're good. They're good, Tommy.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: What is it with you? Can't you talk? You got like a funny attitude. I can't figure you out, Joey. What's with you and the quick answers? You wanna get outa here fast?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Aw, Tommy, c'mon, it ain't that.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: Look Joey, I wanna tell you something. Your brother ain't gonna get nowhere without us -- nowhere. And I'm tellin' you between the two of us, it's gettin' to the point where it's gettin' to be a real embarrassment to me, a real embarrassment.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: How can he embarrass you?

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: He's an embarrassment because Frankie and the other guys are expectin' me to do something about it, and I'm lookin' very bad. I can't deliver a kid from my own neighborhood. Why's he make it so hard on himself? He comes to me, I can make it easier for him.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Tommy, Jake respects you. He won't even say hello to anybody else -- you know that. But you know when Jake gets set on somethin', Jesus Christ Almighty could get off the fuckin' cross and he ain't gonna talk him out of it. I'm his kid brother. I got no say with Jake on this. He thinks he can buck everybody and make it on his own.

turns.speaker: COMO
turns.text: Make it on his own? Does he know the kind of money involved? I mean the real money. He thinks he's gonna become champ on his own? We're gonna sit by and see some nut come in there and hold one of the most important titles in the world? A nut who don't listen to nobody or respect nobody? Is he really crazy? Listen, Joey, you understand, you tell him. I don't care how great he is or how colorful. He could beat all the Sugar Ray Robinsons and all the Janiros he wants to. He ain't gonna get a shot at the title without us. I'm not askin' you to do another thing except get that message into that thick head!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What's up, Colonel?

turns.speaker: EAGAN
turns.text: I'd like to talk to Jake a minute.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What who's been sayin'?

turns.speaker: EAGAN
turns.text: You were a big favorite in this fight. Then two days ago the odds start jumping all over the place until you're a 12-5 underdog.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I don't follow no gamblin' Commissioner. I'm just a fighter.

turns.speaker: EAGAN
turns.text: Now the fight's off the books altogether. Meyer Lansky couldn't get a bet down on this fight. Some people are saying you're going into the tank.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Believe what you want.

turns.speaker: EAGAN
turns.text: I want to believe you, LaMotta.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm gonna kill him. That fuckin' jig's gonna wish he never came outa the jungle. You got any money?

turns.speaker: EAGAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You got any money you want to bet on Billy Fox, you can put it right here...  'cause Jake LaMotta don't go down for nobody.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: This looks done.

turns.speaker: IRMA
turns.text: It's not done.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It looks done. I'll take it the way it is.

turns.speaker: IRMA
turns.text: Here's your steak. You can't wait for it to be done. Here.

turns.speaker: IRMA
turns.text: Here's your carrots. You're in such a hurry. You can't wait.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, I can't wait. You know when I wait? When it's important to wait. It's not important to wait for no steak. It's important to wait for Reeves to leave the ring. It ain't important to wait for no steak! I won that fight. So, I stayed in the ring, and that way I made sure everybody knew it. I shoulda knocked him out earlier, sonofabitch.

turns.speaker: IRMA
turns.text: Where you going at this hour?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What're you, a cop? I'm goin' out -- business.

turns.speaker: IRMA
turns.text: You fuckin' worm, if you're going out, I'm going out.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And where you goin'?

turns.speaker: IRMA
turns.text: None of your fuckin' business.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: J.R., glad you could make it.

turns.speaker: J.R.
turns.text: You were great, Jake. Just like old times. Good thing Sugar Ray wasn't here tonight. Oh Jake, this is State's Attorney Bronson and his wife.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're a good sport, lady.

turns.speaker: J.R.
turns.text: I saw you fight Bob Satterfield in '46, Jake. In Chicago. You were great.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, I really cleaned up on him.

turns.speaker: J.R.
turns.text: Where's your wife, Jake?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Do you think I'd let her in a place like this with guys like you hangin' around?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Nothing...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Hey, c'mon, what's the matter?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I ain't ever gonna fight Joe Louis, that's what's the matter.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What're you talking about? He's a heavyweight. You're a middleweight.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: That's what I'm sayin'. You shouldn't even think like that. It's crazy.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I tell you one thing. Ok, I'll never be big enough to fight Louis, but I know Joey, I know...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You know?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah. Do me a favor.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Sure. What is it?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hit me in the face.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You want me to do what?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You heard me, I said hit me.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: C'mon, Jack. You had a few drinks.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Go ahead. I ain't drunk. Take your best shot. On the jaw.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Jack, I got no gloves.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Here's your glove.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Harder.  Take the towel off.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Jack! Enough!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What was that for? I know you can take punches. I can hit you from now to doomsday. What the fuck does that prove?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: See that, I don't feel it. I can take it. I know I can take anybody.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Answer me when I talk to you.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. They just wanted to talk to you. So I...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't ever bring those kids up here again! I'm working out, I'm killin' myself in here, and they walk around like they fuckin' own the neighborhood.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And that hard-on, Salvy. Who's he think he is? I'm gonna let that fuckin' hard-on come up here and act like a big shot.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What are you getting so hot about -- Tommy Como told him to come down here...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hey, I don't care about Tommy Como. I don't care about Jesus Christ on the fuckin' cross. I gotta give them a percentage of what I make! I'm in here breaking my ass, not them. Don't ever bring them up here again.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I didn't tell them to come. Tommy Como...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Whadda you care?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Whadda ya mean, whadda I care? Who is she? What's a matter? You afraid I'm gonna take her on you?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: No, I'm not afraid. Why? You wanna meet her?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah --

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Cause I'll go right over there and bring her here.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Go 'head.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You sure you wanna meet her? Don't make me go over there, you change your mind and you make me look bad, cause she's really a knockout. She's 15, this kid -- a great piece of ass.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How do you know? You know her that good?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: No, I see her around the pool. I know her. I know her like that -- not like that.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Nah, not now... I wanna wait. I don't feel right...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I'm tellin' you, she'll be there, I know she'll be there.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: 'Cause I wanna catch her alone.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: How you gonna catch anybody alone at a dance?... I don't know if she'll be there alone... She'll probably be there with her girlfriends or something.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: She ever go with them? Like Salvy?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Nah, she don't go with nobody. She's only 15 years old.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What does that have to do with it? She don't look 15 to me. I heard somethin' with Salvy. She was with him once or somethin', I think. It was like some blonde. That's the one...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Probably. You know she talks to everybody, and not just him.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, she's nice.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Ah, some piece of ass, I'm tellin' you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You wasn't with her, were you?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You wasn't with her?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: With her? How?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You know, like bang her or anything?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Ah, no, no. I didn't bang her. I know her from around here, that's all. You want to meet her or what?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Nah, not now -- all those hard-ons around. I'll wait. Not now.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I'm tellin' you, she'll be there, I know she'll be there. Dressed up and everything.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I don't like all those other clowns around. That's all I know.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: C'mon, hurry up. We're never gonna get outa here tonight.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hey, watch your mouth. Don't talk like that. She's still my wife.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: No, but Jake... how much abuse can you take.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How many times do I have to hit her? I hit her enough.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Do you see her yet?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Give me a chance. Let me look.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: He fights the toughest guys around that everybody else is afraid to fight...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm the only guy ever to beat Sugar Ray, and I still don't have a shot at the title.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: They robbed us! Those fuckin' judges -- What the fuck fight were they watching? If I see them on the street, I'll break their heads. Decision Robinson, my fuckin' ass! Those judges give him the decision 'cause he's goin in the army next week! How else could this have happened?... What do you think they gave him the decision for, that's why.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Whadda I gotta do, Joey? I knocked him down. What did I do wrong? I don't understand.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You won and was robbed! You didn't do nothin' wrong.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I dunno. Maybe I don't deserve to win. I've done a lot of bad things. I dunno...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You want us to wait for you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, take her home. I wanna be alone for a while. Everybody go.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I just weighed myself -- I'm 161. No more deals like this Janiro bullshit. I didn't tell you to do it in the first place.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Jake, you're the one who said you could get down to 155! What did I do, pull it out of the fuckin' hat?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, sometimes you shouldn't listen to me! Now I don't know if I can make it down to 155. I'm having trouble making 160, and without telling me, you sign me for a fight at 155 pounds, and if I don't make 155, I forfeit $15,000! You're supposed to know what you're doin'. You're supposed to be a manager!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You want the title shot?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Say what you're gonna say.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You want the title shot or not?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Say what you gotta say. Don't be a smart ass.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: This Janiro's an up-and-coming fighter, this kid you gotta knock out. Knockout this fuckin' kid! I'm telling you, this is your step towards getting a shot at the title. Listen to me: I'm telling you. You been killin' yourself for three years. There's nobody left -- they're afraid to fight you. This Janiro's up-and- coming. He don't know. Fuckin' tear him apart, wipe him out! What are you worried about? Your weight? Look, even if you lose they're gonna think you're weak; they're gonna think you're not the fighter you used to be. They'll match you with guys they were afraid to match you with before, and then you'll kill them and you'll get your title shot. And if you beat this kid Janiro, they gotta give you a shot at the title because there's nobody else. Either way you win and you do it on your own -- just like you want it. All right?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Nah, she would never...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Didn't you just see her lookin' at him? She told me no, but I don't believe her.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: C'mon, Jake. You know she's crazy about you.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Excuse me for a minute. Be right back.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't be long. I'm afraid with all these tough guys here.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Whatcha doin'?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I remember the first time I met Vickie... I know there's somethin' up. I know she's doin' somethin', but I can't catch her...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Maybe she's afraid you're gonna hit her so she can't talk to you the way she wants to.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Try talkin' to her. She's your wife -- ask her what's the matter.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: When I'm away, did you ever notice anythin' funny with her? Tell me the truth.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Jack, if there was anything funny, I would tell you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I want you to keep an eye on her when I'm not here. Understand?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Sure, I'll keep an eye on her.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What did Tommy say?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I got good news, and I got bad news. The good news is you got your shot at the title. The bad news is...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Stick out your hands, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: C'mon, Joey.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: G'wan, do it.  Protect yourself, rummy.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: See? That's all there was to it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What the fuck they want? I took the dive. They want me to fall down too? I don't fall down for nobody. I never went down in my life. Joey, what do I gotta do? Crawl on my hands and knees? I made an asshole of myself in the fuckin' Garden! All the newspaper writers make fun of me. I'm the bum of the year. All I want is a shot. Just a fuckin' shot. What do I gotta do? I'll do anything.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Except fall down like a normal person.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, except fall down. That's right.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: All right, you don't wanna fall down, so now you gotta take a rest. So, you enjoy the suspension. 'Cause there's nothin' you can do about it. Let the Commissioner and the D.A. jerk you around. So you wait.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Jesus Christ! Seven months! What am I gonna do for seven months? I'm gonna go crazy. How do I keep my strength? By that time I'll be too weak to win the title. And my weight? Forget about it -- I'm gonna blow up like a balloon. I ain't never gonna hold my weight down. Seven months! I don't know...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: We did what we had to do. Tommy don't forget. Sooner or later you'll get your shot -- if Tommy don't die.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I'm gonna order up some stuff. Have a steak.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I can't eat a steak. If I eat a steak, I'm gonna have trouble making the weigh-in.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: So eat just a little. You gotta eat something.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What am I gonna do for 24 hours? I can't even eat!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Screw you, Jack.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where you been?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What? I just said hello. Since when I can't kiss my sister-in-law?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ain't a cheek ever good enough for you? I never even kissed Mama on the mouth.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Well, you're not supposed to kiss your mother on the mouth.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, that's what I mean.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I can't tell. You're stomach's in the way.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Answer me somethin'. What happened at the Copa with Salvy when I was out of town?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You know, when you gave him a beatin'.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Nothin'. Salvy was out of line. He was drunk or somethin', I dunno. Anyway, the windup was I gave him a beatin'. Tommy called me down, and we straightened it out. It's all forgotten about.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me about it?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: It didn't have nothin' to do with you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Didn't it have nothin' to do with me?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: No, I just told you what happened.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who did it have anything to do with... Vickie?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Jack, no. I just explained the whole thing to you. It was just between me and Salvy, if it had anything to do with you and Vickie, I woulda told you about it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, I heard some things.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Whatever you touched, that's good now.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Did Salvy fuck Vickie?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're supposed to keep an eye on her for me. I'm askin'...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I did keep an eye...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Then why did you give him a beatin' if he didn't do anything? You and him been friends a long time.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Some things changed between us. Now, he thinks who the fuck he is. He's been passing certain remarks that I don't like.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't bullshit me, Joey. You ain't tellin' me the truth.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What bullshit? Hey, I'm your brother. You wanna believe me -- you trust me?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: When it comes to her, I don't trust nobody. I'm askin' you somethin'.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Well, you're wrong Jack. I'm tellin" you what happened. He got outta line, we had a fight, and it's straightened out now.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You givin' me that look. I gotta accept your word, but if I find out anythin', I'm gonna kill somebody...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: So, go ahead. Kill everybody. Kill Salvy, kill Vickie, kill Tommy Como, kill me while you're at it. What do I care? You're killing yourself the way you're eating, the way you worry about things you don't have to worry about.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you mean, "you"?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you mean, "you"?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I meant, kill everybody. You or me or anybody. You're a big shot. Kill, kill... g'head.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: But you said "you."

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Eh, Joey, even you don't know what you meant. You mentioned Salvy, Tommy Como, you -- that means somethin'. Why'd you say them? You coulda said anybody.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You're worried about this girl, you're gonna let this girl ruin you're life for you... You wanna worry, worry about your fuckin' stomach that you can't bend over -- that you gotta step in the ring in a month.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Did you ever fuck my wife?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I don't mean now. I mean before -- before we met.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Whadda ya mean?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Did you ever fuck my wife?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Whatsa matter with you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're very smart, Joey, very smart. Nobody gives me a straight answer around here. You're givin' me these answers, but you still didn't answer my question. Did you fuck Vickie?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I gotta go. I gotta get outta here. I can't take this shit. Lenore is waitin' for me. I gotta go. You're a definite wacko. You're fuckin' crazy, you know that, crazy.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Was Vickie part of the deal with Tommy? Was my wife part of the deal? Tell me, was that it?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Stop it. What're you, crazy?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm tellin' you now, when I read this, it better not make me look bad.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: Jake, did I ever make you look bad before?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Maybe it wasn't you, but you know what I'm talkin' about.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Why not? There's nobody else around who wants to fight me; they're all afraid. I don't see why I shouldn't have a shot at the title right now.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: Well, the word is to get a title shot you have to cooperate with the people who control boxing, in New York. And they're saying that you don't cooperate.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You guys know more about that than I do. I just fight...

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: You just fought Sugar Ray two weeks ago and you're training like this right now... Are you afraid Sugar Ray might beat you this time?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I tell you what. You hit me here.  Sugar Ray hits me here.  I can't tell the difference. I just fight.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm pulling out of next Wednesday's TV bout 'cause I can't make the weight. I'm fighting at light heavyweight, and I still can't make the weight.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: Does that mean...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It means I'm through with boxing. I'm tired with tryin' to make the weight anymore. I'm sick of thinkin' about weight, weight, weight.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: You sound bitter.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Why should I be bitter? Boxing's been good to me. I got a nice house, three kids, a beautiful wife -- take a picture of her. Vickie.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ain't she beautiful? Coulda been Mrs. America if I didn't pull her outa the contest. Didn't want her wearing a swimsuit for nobody but me.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: What do you think of Jake's retirement, Mrs. LaMotta?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Don't fight anymore!  It's a free country, don't fight anymore!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Why did they have to stop it? Why did they have to stop it?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: It ain't worth it, Jake. Get out.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Nine o'clock.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: At night?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Yeah. At night.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How many pounds I gotta lose?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Three more, I figure.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Just give me a chip of ice to put in my mouth. Just a chip of ice.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: I'll give you anything you want, Jake. I think you should come out for a few minutes -- give yourself a break.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Are you outa your mind? If I come out, I'll lose the title.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: He ain't hurting me, but I can't get him down.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Don't talk. Keep at it. Jab, jab, jab. You're ahead on points.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Joey said you wanted to meet me. Is that right? You wanted to meet me?

turns.speaker: VICKIE
turns.text: I just wanted to say hello.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You wanted to say hello, eh? I can't believe it. When did you fall outa heaven? Anyone ever tell you you're the most beautiful one here, princess of the pool. You got a baby face. Look at mine. Whatcha wanna meet me for?

turns.speaker: VICKIE
turns.text: I don't know. 'Cause you're cute.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ya hear, Joey? She thinks this face is cute? Hey, whatcha doin' now? You wanna go for a ride?
